title: Chicken Biryani
steps: Soak rice 30 min. Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic, chili, turmeric, salt 30 min; fry onions golden (reserve half). Bloom whole spices in oil.
Add chicken + tomatoes to pot; cook till oil separates. Parboil rice 70% with salt; drain.
Layer chicken → rice → fried onions → mint/coriander; sprinkle a splash of water/ghee; seal and cook on low 20 min (dum). Rest 5 min; fluff.

title: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken (yogurt, ginger-garlic, turmeric, chili, salt) 30 min; sear in oil+butter till lightly charred; remove.
Sauté onions golden; add tomato puree; cook till thick and glossy. Stir in chili, garam masala, salt.
Return chicken; simmer 10–15 min. Finish with cream + kasuri methi + a knob of butter; rest 2 min.

title: Chole Bhature
steps: Pressure-cook chickpeas till soft (reserve liquor). For masala, sauté onions golden; add ginger-garlic; add tomato puree + turmeric + chili + chole masala; cook till oil splits.
Add chickpeas + liquor; simmer 20 min to thick, glossy gravy; finish with green chilies and salt.
Bhature: knead flour + semolina + yogurt + salt with water; rest 2 hrs. Roll discs; deep-fry puffed and golden.

title: Rogan Josh
steps: Heat ghee; bloom cardamom, cloves, cinnamon; brown onions. Fry ginger-garlic 1 min.
Sear meat well; add chili, turmeric, fennel, salt; stir. Lower heat, whisk in yogurt gradually.
Add ~1 cup water; cover, simmer 45–60 min till tender. Finish with garam masala; rest 5 min.

title: Rajma Chawal
steps: Pressure-cook rajma till creamy-soft. Sauté onions golden; add ginger-garlic + chilies; 1 min.
Add tomato puree + turmeric + chili + cumin + salt; cook till oil splits; add rajma + cooking liquor; simmer 25 min.
Stir in garam masala; simmer 5 min. Cook basmati; serve rajma over rice.

title: Nihari
steps: In ghee, brown onions; fry ginger-garlic. Add meat; sear hard.
Add turmeric, chili, coriander, salt; cover with 6–7 cups water; slow-cook 3–4 hrs (or pressure 1–2 hrs).
Whisk flour in water; stir in to thicken; simmer 20 min. Finish with garam masala + chilies + coriander; serve with lemon and naan.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: Knead soft dough (flour, salt, water); rest 20 min. Mix filling: potatoes, onion, chilies, ginger, cumin, garam masala, coriander, salt.
Stuff dough ball with filling; rest 5 min; roll gently to 6–7 inch.
Roast on hot tawa with ghee/oil till golden spots both sides; serve with butter, curd, pickle.

title: Masala Dosa
steps: Masala: temper mustard, urad, curry leaves; sauté onion + chili; add turmeric + salt; toss potatoes; mash lightly; finish lemon + coriander.
Heat tawa; spread thin dosa; drizzle oil; cook till crisp.
Place masala, fold, serve with coconut chutney + sambar.

title: Idli & Sambar
ingredients: Mustard + urad + curry leaves + red chilies
steps: Steam idlis 10–12 min; rest 2 min; unmould. Pressure-cook dal with turmeric; whisk smooth.
Temper oil with mustard, urad, curry leaves, red chilies; sauté onion; add tomato + veg; add dal + water; simmer.
Add sambar powder + salt; simmer till veg tender; finish tamarind; garnish coriander; serve with idli.

title: Hyderabadi Biryani
steps: Parboil salted rice 70% with whole spices; drain. Marinate meat (yogurt, ginger-garlic, spices, lemon, half fried onions, herbs) 45–60 min.
Layer raw marinated meat then rice; top with remaining fried onions, herbs, saffron milk, ghee.
Seal and dum 30–40 min low heat till meat done and rice fluffy; rest 10 min; fluff.

title: Kerala Fish Curry
steps: Heat coconut oil; crackle fenugreek; add curry leaves + chilies; sauté onion soft; fry ginger-garlic briefly.
Add chili + turmeric; splash water; add tomatoes (or coconut milk) + tamarind + salt; simmer 5–7 min.
Slide fish; cover, cook low 8–10 min till just done; rest 5 min; serve with rice/appam.

title: Appam with Stew
steps: Stew: in coconut oil, bloom whole spices + curry leaves + ginger + chilies; sauté onion; add veg/chicken; toss.
Pour thin coconut milk; simmer till tender; finish with thick coconut milk + salt (do not boil).
Appam: swirl batter in appam pan; cover to set; edges crisp, center soft; serve with stew.

title: Chettinad Chicken
steps: Sauté onions golden; add ginger-garlic; add tomatoes; cook mushy.
Add turmeric, chili, Chettinad masala; stir till fragrant.
Add chicken; sear; splash water; cover and simmer 25–30 min; finish with curry leaves and salt.

title: Pongal
steps: Lightly roast moong dal. Pressure-cook rice + dal with turmeric, salt, 4 cups water till soft and porridge-like.
In ghee, fry cashews golden; remove. In same ghee, splutter cumin + crushed pepper + curry leaves + ginger.
Fold tempering into pongal; top with cashews; serve hot.

title: Litti Chokha
steps: Dough: knead flour + salt + water (stiff). Filling: mix sattu, onion, garlic, chilies, carom, mustard oil, salt (few drops water).
Stuff litti balls; bake/grill/air-fry till cooked through (or deep-fry); brush with ghee.
Chokha: roast brinjal + tomato; peel; mash with potatoes, onion, mustard oil, coriander, salt. Serve with hot litti.

title: Macher Jhol (Fish Curry)
steps: Marinate fish with salt + turmeric; shallow-fry in mustard oil; keep aside.
In same oil, temper panch phoron + bay; sauté potatoes; add ginger + tomato; cook soft; add turmeric + chili + water.
Simmer potatoes till tender; add fried fish; simmer 5–7 min; finish with green chilies + coriander.

title: Pakhala Bhata
ingredients: Tempering: mustard seeds, dried red chilies, curry leaves, mustard oil (opt)
steps: Cool cooked rice completely; loosen in a pot. Add water/buttermilk + curd (opt) + salt + chilies + ginger; stir.
Cover and rest/ferment 8–12 hrs (overnight) at room temp.
Optional: temper mustard oil with mustard seeds, red chilies, curry leaves; pour over. Sprinkle roasted cumin; serve chilled with sides.

title: Pav Bhaji
steps: On tawa, melt butter; sauté onions soft; add capsicum; add tomatoes; cook mushy.
Add masalas + salt; mash in potatoes + peas; add splashes of water; cook till smooth, glossy, deep red bhaji.
Toast pav with butter; serve bhaji topped with butter, onion, coriander, lemon.

title: Vada Pav
steps: Tempering: mustard + curry leaves + chilies + ginger; mix into mashed potatoes with turmeric + salt; cool; shape balls.
Make thick besan batter (salt, pinch soda). Dip potato balls; deep-fry till golden.
Slit pav; smear dry garlic chutney; tuck in vada; press; serve with fried green chili.

title: Misal Pav
steps: Boil sprouts till tender. Make tarri: mustard + curry leaves tempering; sauté onion; add tomato; cook mushy.
Add turmeric + chili + misal masala + salt; add water; simmer 10–15 min to spicy gravy.
Assemble bowls: sprouts + tarri + farsan + onion + coriander + lemon. Serve with toasted pav.

title: Dhokla
ingredients: Tempering: oil, mustard, sesame, curry leaves, green chilies
Syrup: 1/2 cup water, 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp lemon
steps: Whisk besan + yogurt + water to pourable batter; add turmeric, ginger-chili, sugar, salt; rest 10 min.
Grease plate; stir in Eno; pour; steam 12–15 min till set. Boil syrup (water + sugar + lemon).
Temper mustard, sesame, curry leaves, chilies in oil; pour over cut dhokla; drizzle syrup; rest 2 min.

title: Thepla
steps: Mix flours, methi, yogurt, spices, salt, oil; add water to knead soft dough; rest 15 min.
Divide; roll thin discs dusting flour.
Roast on hot tawa with light oil/ghee till brown spots both sides; serve with pickle/curd.

title: Goan Fish Curry
ingredients: Masala: grated coconut, Kashmiri chilies, coriander, cumin, garlic, turmeric, tamarind/kokum
steps: Blend coconut + chilies + spices + tamarind to smooth paste with water.
Sauté onion in coconut oil; add masala + water to curry consistency; simmer 5–7 min; salt.
Add fish; simmer gently 8–10 min till cooked; rest 5 min; serve with rice.

title: Laal Maas
ingredients: Red chili paste (10–12 dried chilies soaked)
steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt, chili paste, turmeric, salt 30 min.
Heat ghee/oil; bloom bay, cloves, black cardamom; brown onions; add garlic; add marinated mutton; sear.
Add water; cover and slow-cook till tender (or pressure). Adjust salt; finish with ghee; rest 10 min.

title: Dal Baati Churma
ingredients: Baati: wheat flour, semolina, ghee, salt, water
Dal: toor+moong+chana dal, onion, tomato, ginger-garlic, turmeric, chili, cumin, ghee
Churma: baked baatis, ghee, sugar/jaggery, nuts
steps: Baati: knead stiff dough with ghee; shape balls; bake/air-fry till golden and cooked; brush with ghee.
Dal: pressure-cook mixed dals with turmeric; temper ghee with cumin, ginger-garlic, onion, tomato, chili; add dal; simmer; salt.
Churma: crush baatis; mix ghee + sugar/jaggery + nuts. Serve: crack baati, pour ghee, ladle dal; finish with churma.

title: Poha
steps: Rinse poha; drain; sprinkle little water + salt + sugar; rest 5 min. Fry peanuts; reserve.
Temper mustard + curry leaves + chilies; sauté onion (and potato) till soft; add turmeric.
Toss in poha; heat gently; adjust moisture with sprinkles of water. Off heat: lemon + peanuts + coriander.

title: Bhutte Ka Kees
steps: Heat ghee; splutter mustard + cumin; add hing, chilies, ginger. Add grated corn; sauté 3–4 min.
Add turmeric, salt, milk (pinch sugar opt); cook, stirring, till thick and glossy.
Finish lemon, coconut, coriander; serve hot.

title: Bamboo Shoot Curry
steps: Parboil bamboo shoots 5–7 min; drain. Heat oil; sauté onion; add ginger-garlic + chilies.
Add tomato + dry spices + salt; cook till oil splits.
Add potatoes + bamboo + 1.5 cups water; simmer till potatoes tender; finish coriander.

title: Smoked Pork with Bamboo Shoot
ingredients: 6–8 dried red chilies (soaked, ground) or chili paste
steps: In pot: pork + ginger-garlic + chili paste + salt; cover with water; simmer 45–60 min till tender.
Add bamboo (and tomato if using); simmer 10–15 min.
Reduce to glossy gravy; adjust salt; serve with steamed rice.

title: Assamese Fish Curry (Masor Tenga)
steps: Rub fish with salt + turmeric; shallow-fry in mustard oil; remove.
Temper mustard/panch phoron; add tomato; cook soft; add water (2 cups) + kokum/lemon + salt; simmer.
Add fish; simmer gently 5–7 min; finish with chilies + coriander.

title: Indian Thali (Meal Platter)
ingredients: Dal tadka (toor dal, turmeric, ghee, cumin, garlic, chilies)
steps: Dal: pressure-cook toor dal with turmeric + salt; temper ghee with cumin, garlic, chilies; pour over.
Dry sabzi: sauté cumin; add veg + spice mix; cook tender and dry. Raita: whisk curd + cucumber + salt + roasted cumin.
Phulkas: roll and roast; cook rice. Assemble platter with all components; garnish coriander + lemon.

title: Prawns Ghee Roast
ingredients: Masala: dried red chilies (Kashmiri), coriander, cumin, pepper, garlic, tamarind, jaggery, salt
steps: Soak chilies; grind with spices, garlic, tamarind, jaggery, salt to thick paste. Toss prawns with turmeric + half masala 10 min.
Heat ghee; fry remaining masala till it releases ghee.
Add prawns; cook 3–5 min till just opaque; toss curry leaves; serve hot.

title: Ragi Ball (Ragi Mudde)
steps: Bring water + salt to a rolling boil. Sprinkle 1 tbsp ragi flour to make a thin slurry (prevents lumps).
Dump in remaining ragi flour all at once; lower heat and beat vigorously with a flat spoon/paddle till lump-free and thick.
Cover 3–5 min on low; beat/knead to a smooth glossy mass. Rest 2 min, wet palms, shape balls. Brush ghee. Serve hot with sambar/saaru.
